posts.name: Gavin Precurato
posts.cooked:
I’m a very new java programmer and I’m trying to make a simple drive train for our robot from last year just to test.

I have a subsystem for DriveTrain and a command for ArcadeDrive. but when I try to add the requirements for the subsystem it says it’s not visible. It can be solved by making m_drivetrain (in Robotcontainer) public and static but I was wondering if this was correct  or if it would cause problems later. The latest code is pushed to github here if anyone wants to take a look: GitHub - FalcoTech/FalcoTech2023: Command Based code for the 2023 season, Charged Up.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
It’s declared as private, which means it can’t be accessed from another class.  Make it public instead.

EDIT: it also needs to be static, see below discussion.

posts.name: Gavin Precurato
posts.cooked: wasn’t sure if it would cause problems later. Much appreciated <3 I’m sure I’ll be back to chiefdelphi with more questions lol

posts.name: keco185
posts.cooked: Also you’re accessing it statically which requires the static keyword. “public static final”

posts.name: Gavin Precurato
posts.cooked: correct me if I’m wrong please: to access something statically means it can be defined/accessed in multiple classes?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: It means that there’s only one of them, rather than one per instantiation (object) of the class.  It also means you can access it via the class name, rather than needing an object of the class.

posts.name: Gavin Precurato
posts.cooked: got it. I think it just threw me off because a lot of examples that I saw were defining their subsystems as private

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: That’s because a more common way to solve this issue (best practice) is to pass the subsystem to the command’s constructor, rather than having the command back-reference a global (static).  This is called dependency injection.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

data.fancy_title: The field m_drivetrain is not visible
data.title: The field m_drivetrain is not visible

accepted_answer.excerpt:
It’s declared as private, which means it can’t be accessed from another class.  Make it public instead. 
EDIT: it also needs to be static, see below discussion.
